pageContext.other: 2 cross section drawings of chisel on reverse., edge is somewhat chipped and damged.
pageContext.publications: Hillies History of the Isle of Wight. Pt. i. p.6.,,  Journ. Brit. Arch. Ass. Winchester. (1846) p. 151.,,  Dennett MS. No 2. fig. iii.
pageContext.collection: Carisbrooke Museum., Presented by Sir L. Holmes.
pageContext.site: England,  (isle of wight), arreton or arreton down or shaleombe down, found by mr. dennett in 1816
pageContext.remarks: It seems uncertain whether this is "the small bronze instrument" said to have been found in a barrow on Shalecombe Down in 1816, or whether it was found about the same time on Arreton Down.  Mr. Crawford is inclined to the latter view.
